byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis and Michael D. Shear contributed reporting.

abstract: Supreme Court rules 6-3 that Pres Obama's Affordable Care Act permits federal government to give nationwide tax subsidies to help poor and middle-class people buy health insurance; assertive vindication endorses bigger intention of Obama's main legislative accomplishment, and insures it will remain after he leaves office in 2017.
lead_paragraph: Affirming a key element of the health care law, the justices ruled that it may provide nationwide tax subsidies to help poor and middle-class people buy insurance.

headline.main: Supreme Court Allows Nationwide Health Care Subsidies
headline.print_headline: Justices Give Obama Another Health Care Victory
headline.sub: 6-3 Ruling, Written by Roberts, Is a Big Victory for Obama

snippet: Affirming a key element of the health care law, the justices ruled that it may provide nationwide tax subsidies to help poor and middle-class people buy insurance.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
